security: Sharing that the Mexican Foreign Minister was “disturbed by the knowledge of the note sent by the Cuban Government to the Mexican Government attributing to it participation in a plot aimed at involving the CASTRO Government int the plan for the attack on KENNEDY” reveals sensitive diplomatic communications and intelligence gathering methods. Disclosing such activity could impair future intelligence efforts and damage international relations.
summary: This report discusses a possible shift in Mexico's stance toward Cuba following a Cuban government note accusing Mexico of involvement in a plot related to the attack on President Kennedy.
summary_one_paragraph: Dated December 2, 1963, this top-secret report from Washington to Buenos Aires suggests a potential change in Mexican-Cuban relations. The message indicates that the Mexican Foreign Minister was upset by the Cuban government's accusation of Mexican involvement in a plot connected to the Kennedy assassination. This disturbance leads to speculation that Mexico may alter its established position regarding Cuba.
title: 3/0/AED/T485-63: POSSIBLE CHANGE IN MEXICAN POSITION TOWARD CUBA
